title: Authorizes employers to make deductions from an employee's wages if such deduction is authorized by the employee and is for the convenience of the employee
summary: Authorizes employers to make deductions from an employee's wages if such deduction is authorized by the employee and is for the convenience of the employee.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2837

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   February 2, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  YOUNG  -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Labor

       AN ACT to amend the labor law, in relation to authorized deductions from
         wages

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Paragraph  b of subdivision 1 of section 193 of the labor
    2  law, as added by chapter 548 of the laws of 1966, is amended to read  as
    3  follows:
    4    b. are expressly authorized in writing by the employee and are for the
    5  benefit OR CONVENIENCE of the employee; provided that such authorization
    6  is  kept  on file on the employer's premises. Such authorized deductions
    7  [shall be limited to]  MAY  INCLUDE  payments  for  insurance  premiums,
    8  pension  or  health  and  welfare  benefits, contributions to charitable
    9  organizations, payments for United States bonds, payments  for  dues  or
   10  assessments  to a labor organization, and similar payments for the bene-
   11  fit OR CONVENIENCE of the employee.  NO DEDUCTION FROM THE WAGES  OF  AN
   12  EMPLOYEE  SHALL  BE MADE PURSUANT TO THIS PARAGRAPH, UNLESS THE AUTHORI-
   13  ZATION THEREFOR IS MADE KNOWINGLY AND VOLUNTARILY BY THE EMPLOYEE, WITH-
   14  OUT ANY UNDUE INFLUENCE OR DURESS BY THE EMPLOYER.
   15    S 2. This act shall take effect on the one hundred eightieth day after
   16  it shall have become a law.




        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00452-01-1
